page.title: 04Fairfield,Buxton:Carnival.
page.content: The tradition of having a Fairfield Carnival was revived in 1984. In{1985}the Carnival was held on Saturday, 15th. June. Julie Swift was the 1985 Carnival Queen. Many Carnival Queens from surrounding towns and villages attended. Not only did Julie Swift's family celebrate her becoming Carnival Queen - the whole of her road was decorated with paper flowers. The grounds of Fairfield Infant School were used for the Carnival. Hundreds of people crowded the streets to watch the procession pass by. There was a troupe of dancers, Fairfield band played and many people wore fancy dress. People walked with the procession collecting money for charity. Nicola Pimblett, Robert Kirk, and Charlotte Lacy won prizes in an art competition. It all finished at five o'clock.
